question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Be sure to ensure that the code you generate is executable when displayed. Please help me implement this SVG image using code. Write with a quill or a feather pen, both are great tools for calligraphy and composing writing using stationery.

checklist.title: Is the basic SVG structure correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG element has proper namespace, dimensions, and viewBox attributes. The SVG should be properly structured with appropriate width, height, and viewBox values to ensure the image scales correctly. Score 0 if no SVG framework is provided, 5 if basic structure exists but with incorrect attributes, and 10 if the structure is complete and properly configured.

checklist.title: Is the quill/feather pen shape accurately rendered?
checklist.description: Evaluate the geometric accuracy of the quill or feather pen. The pen should have a realistic feather shape with proper barbs, shaft, and nib. Check for path precision, curve smoothness, and anatomical accuracy of the feather. Deduct 5 points if the basic shape is recognizable but lacks details, and 3 points if proportions are incorrect. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Are the visual details and texturing techniques implemented?
checklist.description: Assess the implementation of texture and detail in the feather using SVG techniques (like patterns, gradients, or path detailing). The quill should show barb texture, shaft details, and nib characteristics. Score 0 for flat coloring only, 5 for basic gradients or patterns, and 10 for sophisticated detailing that creates a realistic feather appearance.

checklist.title: Is the calligraphy/writing effect properly demonstrated?
checklist.description: Check if the SVG includes a demonstration of writing or calligraphy, such as an ink path, written text, or a writing motion effect. For interactive versions, evaluate any animation showing the writing process. Deduct 5 points if no writing effect is shown, and 3 points if the effect is basic without realistic ink flow dynamics. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code handles different browsers, screen sizes, and device capabilities appropriately. SVG should render consistently across platforms with fallbacks if needed. Check for proper namespace handling, cross-browser compatibility attributes, and responsive design considerations. Score 10 points for comprehensive compatibility, 5 for average robustness with some limitations, and 0 if major compatibility issues exist.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Animation of the quill writing 2. Interactive elements that respond to user input 3. Dynamic ink flow effects). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Unnecessary path points or shapes that increase file size 2. Duplicate definitions or unused elements 3. Overly complex implementations that could be simplified. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core rendering is obscured by excessive elements.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular organization (such as separating definitions, main elements, and effects), proper naming conventions, and code maintainability. Deduct 5 points if element IDs/classes are poorly named or inconsistent; deduct 5 points if there's excessive repetition of code that could be grouped; deduct 5 points if there's no logical organization of SVG elements. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the visual design meet professional artistic standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the quill/feather pen design follows artistic principles: 1) Proper proportion and perspective 2) Harmonious color scheme 3) Appropriate stylistic choices for the era or style of calligraphy represented. Deduct 3 points for anatomical inaccuracies, 5 points for historically incorrect representation, and 5 points for poor artistic composition. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the performance and optimization of the SVG appropriate?
checklist.description: Judge whether the SVG is efficiently implemented: 1) Minimal path points while maintaining visual quality 2) Appropriate use of groups and reusable elements 3) Optimized file size without unnecessary precision or attributes. Deduct 5 points for SVG with excessive nodes (>500 when unnecessary), 3 points for unoptimized transformation matrices, and 5 points for neglecting to use defs for repeated elements. The full score is 10 points.
